summary: This is an FBI FD-999 liaison report documenting a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) review team meeting held via teleconference on July 13, 2021. The meeting, involving multiple federal agencies in the US Virgin Islands, discussed SARs from June 2021 and identified specific persons and entities of interest, including the Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein and several associated individuals and companies.

events.title: SAR Review Team Meeting
events.description: A Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) review meeting held by teleconference with the USAO in the US Virgin Islands, attended by multiple federal agencies including FBI, IRS, DEA, and DHS OIG. The team discussed SARs from June 2021 and identified specific persons and entities of interest.

events.title: Scheduled Next SAR Review Meeting
events.description: The next SAR review meeting was scheduled for 10 August 2021 at 10:00 a.m., as noted in the liaison report.

keyFacts: A multi-agency SAR review team meeting was held on July 13, 2021, focusing on financial crimes in the US Virgin Islands.
The 'Estate of Jeffery E. Epstein' was explicitly listed as an item of interest derived from the review of June 2021 Suspicious Activity Reports.
Several individuals, including Richard D. Kahn and Darren K. Indyke, were identified as persons of interest in connection with the SAR review.
The meeting involved agencies including the FBI, U.S. Attorney's Office, IRS, DEA, and DHS Office of Inspector General, indicating a coordinated financial investigation.
The document shows ongoing post-mortem financial scrutiny of Epstein's estate and associates well into 2021.
